Name.BusinessNameLine1: CANCER RESEARCH FUND OF THE DAMON

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Accelerating breakthroughs by funding the best young scientists pursuing innovative research
IRS990.MissionDescription: To accelerate breakthroughs, the Damon Runyon Cancer Research Foundation provides today's best young scientists with funds to pursue innovative research.
IRS990.Description: Fellowship Awards: Supports the training of the brightest postdoctoral scientists as they embark upon their research careers. This funding enables them to explore their own innovative ideas while working with leading senior scientists in top universities and cancer research centers.

Activity2.Description: Clinical Investigator Awards: Supports early career physician-scientists conducting patient-oriented research. The goal of this program is to increase the number of physicians capable of moving seamlessly between the laboratory and the patient's bedside in search of breakthrough treatments.

Activity3.Description: Innovation Awards: Supports the next generation of exceptionally creative thinkers with "high risk/high reward" ideas that have the potential to significantly impact our understanding of and/or approaches to the prevention, diagnosis or treatment of cancer, but lack sufficient preliminary data to obtain traditional funding.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income: MISCELLANEOUS INCOME OIL AND GAS INCOME

OtherAssets.Description: AMOUNT HELD IN TRUST BY OTHERS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Endowment assets represent available funds allocated by the Foundation for long-term investment. Endowment assets include funds received from donors for funding of scientific awards that are included in temporarily restricted net assets.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: On July 1, 2009, the Foundation adopted the accounting standard on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes, which addresses the determination of whether tax benefits claimed or expected to be claimed on a tax return should be recorded in the financial statements. Under this guidance, the Foundation may recognize the tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by taxing authorities, based on the technical merits of the position. The tax benefits to be recognized in the financial statements from such a position are measured based on the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon ultimate settlement. The guidance on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes also addresses de-recognition, classification, interest and penalties on income taxes. Management evaluated the Foundation's tax positions and concluded that the Foundation had taken no uncertain tax positions that require adjustment to the financial statements to comply with the provisions of this guidance. With few exceptions, the Foundation is no longer subject to income tax examinations by the U.S. federal, state or local tax authorities for years before 2007, which is the standard statute of limitations look-back period.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: DAMON RUNYON CLINICAL INVESTIGATOR AWARDS & CONTINUATION GRANTS

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES ANNUAL REPORTS OF PROGRESS BY THE AWARDEES AS WELL AS AN ACCOUNTING OF THE AWARD EXPENDITURES.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Method for Determining Number of Contributors:
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: the number of contributors above represents the total number of donors who donated securities to the organization during the year.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Dale Frey Award for Breakthrough Scientists is named in honor of the past chairman. this award will provide $100,000 in research funding to two or three Damon Runyon Fellows who, upon completion of their fellowship, surpassed the Foundation's very high expectations and show extraordinary promise as breakthrough scientists.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 is reviewed first by the Executive Director and Chief Financial Officer. It is then presented to the Audit Committee for review and approval. It is subsequently provided to the Board of Directors for information before it's filed with the irs and is then reviewed at the next board meeting.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Conflict of Interest Policy is provided to all members of the Board of Directors as well as all members of the staff on an annual basis. Each person must indicate that they read the policy, understand it and are in full compliance with it. Potential conflicts of interest must be noted on the form, which is then reviewed by the Executive Director and/or Audit Committee as appropriate. The form is signed, dated and returned to the organization.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation of the Chief Executive Officer is determined annually after review of her performance by the Chairman of the Board, who then presents his review and recommendation on compensation to the Executive Committee of the Board for approval. It is then approved by the Board of Directors in Executive Session at its next meeting. The compensation of all other senior staff is set by the Executive Director, subject to approval of the executive committee of the Board, after a review of performance and comparability data collected from 990's of other similar organizations.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available to the public upon request. The financial statements are also posted on the organization's website.
